column1: Happy Thanksgiving to all! While our celebrations might look different I am thankful for the strength and compassion shown by our community through everything this year. Hope you and your family have a wonderful holiday! https://t.co/CRk6iCjxoD
We can all do our part by:   - Avoiding non-essential travel - When outside our household - wearing a mask and social distancing especially when indoors   - Participating in virtual gatherings

This year #COVID19 will require us to adjust our traditional Thanksgiving gatherings. It is critical that we take the proper precautions this holiday season to keep our friends and families safe. https://t.co/x0mq8q2AKV
Are you a non-filer and haven’t received your Economic Impact Payment yet? Have you filed a 2019 tax return? If no you can request your stimulus check Until Nov. 21. https://t.co/RNIKUfmUd1

Glad the FCC has voted to make critical modernizations to the 5.9GHz band. I have consistently called for these updates to boost Wi-Fi and give consumers the speed they expect. Wi-Fi has been a lifeline throughout the pandemic and it needs to stay fast and reliable. #FCCLive

The MODERN Labeling Act supports FDA’s ability to require modifications to outdated generic drug labels so they reflect new relevant information. It is vital that Americans and their providers have access to accurate up-to-date information about a drug’s safety and efficacy.

More than 32 million Americans live with potentially life-threatening food allergies. The FASTER Act updates food allergen labeling laws to include sesame & lays critical groundwork for conducting the research to better understand treat & one day prevent food allergies.

Today the House passed two of my bills: the FASTER Act and MODERN Labeling Act. Both bills are bipartisan common sense solutions that take important steps to safeguard our public health. https://t.co/mip7szVYCH
Joined @TheHillEvents today to talk about what proved important to 50+ voters this election and how we tackle their priorities moving forward. https://t.co/Up08NrRxIo
On Veterans Day we honor all of the brave servicemembers who have answered the call to serve and defend our nation.  We thank them for their service and sacrifice. https://t.co/I40WK8dwUC
In the case before the Supreme Court today a Republican win to destroy the ACA will take away coverage from millions of Americans in the middle of a pandemic. That’s why I am fighting to #SaveTheACA.

The ACA has been a literal lifeline – protecting 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions and making sure that tens of millions of those historically underserved are no longer priced out or shut out from the health coverage they need. https://t.co/X08Xx6l4aP

A special congratulations to my fellow Californian Vice President-elect Kamala Harris. As the first woman Black and Indian-American Vice President in our nation’s history millions across the nation are seeing a dream realized. You are truly an inspiration for us all.
Congratulations President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris!   The American people have spoken – and we have chosen compassion truth and unity to lead us.

The President’s unproven claims of fraud are dangerous and undermine faith in our democratic process.   We will count every vote fairly and accurately. This is our constitutional right – each American will have their voice heard.

I was happy to join @SacFoodBank this morning to distribute food to our Sacramento families. I know this year has been challenging as we face this unprecedented crisis but I thank the food bank staff and volunteers for filling the increased need for our community. https://t.co/qNKuVNo35X

Thank you to Peter Lee and @CoveredCA for joining me today for our conversation on the state of the #ACA. Head over to my Facebook page to watch the full discussion!   https://t.co/oKFwkMO8e1 https://t.co/IKsgWX0p5Q

Please join me tomorrow at 10:30 AM PST for a conversation on the state of the Affordable Care Act with Peter Lee Executive Director of @CoveredCA. With open enrollment starting Nov 1 we will discuss coverage options & concerns on the future of the ACA.  https://t.co/M6Y9lkVEH8 https://t.co/m1C4diknA3

Latina women make 55 cents on the dollar as compared to white men. Latinas and their families deserve better. @HouseDemocrats already passed legislation to address this issue – the Senate must do its part to pass the #PaycheckFairnessAct! #LatinasAreEssential https://t.co/RgSsOEq8kL
Sacramento residents! It’s not too late to apply for Emergency Rental Assistance. See below for more information and additional housing resources. https://t.co/LCiQhGuZVN

Thank you Dr. Beilenson and Dr. Kasirye for joining me this morning for a COVID-19 update conversation. We can all continue helping our community by:   •Wearing a face covering •Maintaining social distance •Avoiding indoor gatherings  We can #TurnSacCountyOrange. https://t.co/jaUNCwIxWU

Please join me tomorrow at 9:30 AM PST for a conversation on COVID-19 in @SacCountyCA with Dr. Peter Beilenson and Dr. Olivia Kasirye. We will discuss how Sacramento residents can continue to help slow the spread of COVID-19 into the winter months.   https://t.co/M6Y9lkVEH8 https://t.co/7DK2fzXoG8

The Japanese American story is not told nearly enough. It is one of pain one of redemption & one of enrichment. This bill ensures that these lessons live into the future – that we share our stories lift our voices & fight so we do not repeat the mistakes of the past.

I am proud to introduce the Japanese American Confinement Education Act a bill to permanently reauthorize the Japanese American Confinement Site program to preserve & educate Americans on the imprisonment of Japanese Americans during World War II. https://t.co/mJ6FJb0SIR

As we continue to face this crisis now is the time to expand National Service and empower Americans to give back to their communities. In each one of these projects we see the impact of their service. #Stand4Service

Today I met one of our many wonderful @AmeriCorpsNCCC teams as they serve our Sacramento community with @sachabitat. AmeriCorps members symbolize a helping hand to communities in times of need & this partnership between local & national service is priceless during the pandemic. https://t.co/gF5dOXOIrn

Today we celebrated many special women who the history books often overlook but who were vital in the fight that made the women’s vote possible. This mural will remind us why we vote - in honor of those who paved the way & to encourage future generations. Use your voice. Vote. https://t.co/NvDFJhHO4R

This close to an election President Trump's executive order to suppress free speech can only be taken as an attempt to censure his political rivals. The FCC should not be allowing #Section230 to be used as a political weapon. https://t.co/7eg5h9OJRR

TODAY is the last day to complete the census. Census data helps us obtain the healthcare transportation schools affordable housing and higher education that our families need to succeed.   Go to https://t.co/j93UeHrp0J or call 844-330-2020 to #BeCounted. https://t.co/WWgxPcnGz6
That's why if you haven't already please complete the census NOW. Go to https://t.co/WRuJpq3sZK - it takes just minutes!

The Supreme Court’s decision to allow the Census to end early is an assault on our Sacramento community and typically undercounted communities. This year during a pandemic a rushed count leads to fewer federal resources. Resources that we deserve. https://t.co/nThyN3Ch22

No child’s health should be put in jeopardy because they have lost access to school meals while remote learning. That is why I joined my colleagues to call on the USDA to extend free meal options for children for the duration of this school year. https://t.co/HTXYE84ooq

I joined my colleagues to express our concerns over the proposed rule that sets arbitrary limitations on student visas. If implemented the rule would undermine our leadership in higher education and put the careers of our international students at risk. https://t.co/hRO4vlda12

The Administration has dragged their feet for months on coming to the aid of Americans & the need for a decisive response from the federal government has only grown more severe. We must continue to work to save jobs get resources to our communities & keep our families healthy.

The President’s announcement is unacceptable – our American heroes should be given the resources they need to put money in their pockets and weather this crisis. Working American families the unemployed and the most vulnerable cannot simply wait out for better days ahead.

By instructing his representatives to walk away from coronavirus relief negotiations the President is showing that he is completely unwilling to embrace bipartisan solutions – even if they save American lives and provide for the essential needs of the American people. https://t.co/hMlc6AfXI1

The FCC's announcement to reinforce its decision to rollback #netneutrality continues policies that could hinder the ability of Americans to access the online content they choose. We must make sure the internet remains an open platform for free expression and innovation. https://t.co/8TGcsnCQuJ

On Sept. 30 CDC issued a new order allowing cruise lines to resume operations in October. Given the alarming rate of COVID-19 spread that has been connected to cruise lines I called on the CDC to provide details on possible transmission rates & consequences of the new Order. https://t.co/JcRysy0R1n

Recently @fema stopped providing relief to states to help schools cover mask and sanitation costs during #COVID19. As schools deal with the beginning of a new school year safety is of the utmost importance. I joined my colleagues to call on FEMA to restart this vital relief. https://t.co/kTUOT55P0T

As we move toward recovery it's crucial that we give our communities workers families & businesses the support they need. We need to keep essential workers on the job & make sure we have the testing contact tracing and surveillance to allow us to return to our daily lives. https://t.co/5gSiXbDT6E

The House voted tonight to pass the updated #HeroesAct. In the four months since House Democrats passed the original Heroes Act the need for a strong decisive response from the federal government has only grown more severe.
600: Bills passed by House Democrats #ForThePeople 150: House bills signed into law 340: Bipartisan bills stuck on McConnell’s desk  @senatemajldr - what are you waiting for? https://t.co/1zgz9fxBFN

Today Justice Ginsburg was honored as the first woman to lie in state at the Capitol. After a lifetime advancing women’s rights Justice Ginsburg has left an indelible mark on the American soul. She will forever be the compass leading us down the path towards justice. https://t.co/0k8j5queLE

Already this year we have seen more than 12000 deaths and more than 425 mass shootings.   All while @senatemajldr McConnell has let #HR8 sit on his desk with no action for 575 days. Today we #WearOrangeMasks to keep up the pressure on the Senate to take action. https://t.co/2Qkgix8b1A

California's decision to halt the sale of gas-powered cars by 2035 is a decisive step to address the climate crisis. Climate change will continue to be a defining fight for decades to come and we must do what is necessary to secure a sustainable future for American families. https://t.co/7rjswrBtVr

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Registering to vote and updating your voter registration information are the first steps to being #VoteReady in the upcoming election. Register to vote at https://t.co/VZfYZknN2q. https://t.co/sdkMAV9WXg

We have until the 30th to ensure that our region is well represented and funded over the next ten years. Complete the census today either online at https://t.co/YTltnX7gHg or by phone by calling 844-330-2020. https://t.co/1u5BYymrlY

While we mourn this tremendous loss we must stand ready to pursue the path Justice Ginsburg showed us – holding ourselves accountable and making sure no one is above the law. My prayers are with her family and loved ones. I stand ready to fight to ensure her legacy lives on.
Justice Ginsburg was not only a brilliant jurist and legal mind but an unparalleled role model for women and girls across our nation.
America has lost a titan of justice and a champion for the voiceless. Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a tireless warrior for equality and a north star for those seeking a more just democracy.

Wonderful news for Sacramento! The new SMUD Museum of Science and Curiosity will be a world of exploration for our region somewhere that will capture our imaginations and bring a new frontier of access to science-literacy for everyone. https://t.co/alL43wAHdb

To keep our children safe and healthy as we continue to combat COVID-19 we must take immediate action to renew P-EBT to support students across the country who have lost access to school meals.      https://t.co/jnCjpo2TB9

The pandemic continues to challenge family budgets & heighten the risk of children going hungry. Since March the Pandemic-EBT program has served as a lifeline for families paying for groceries ensuring that kids are fed at home while schools transition to virtual learning.

The appalling whistleblower allegations of mass hysterectomies on detained immigrant women deserve our collective outrage and a thorough investigation. Today I joined my colleagues to demand immediate action from the DHS Inspector General. https://t.co/zNvYbc7p1e

That's why I'm proud to lead a resolution recognizing September 11 as a national day of service to honor those who served in our time of need & urge Americans to engage in national service. This resolution serves as a reminder of our nation’s resiliency when we stand together. https://t.co/XUtCuxcv77

In the face of the tragic events of 9/11 first responders service members & communities united to heal a wounded nation. As we honor those who lost their lives we also renew our commitment to serving our nation to build bridges between communities & unite us all as Americans.

The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline is a national network that provides FREE & CONFIDENTIAL support to those experiencing suicidal crisis or emotional distress.   The services are provided 24/7 7 days a week. If you or a loved one are in a crisis call 1(800) 273-8255.

The #COVID19 pandemic has taken a heavy toll on the mental health of Americans.   This week is #SuicidePreventionWeek and it is a reminder to check in on our friends and family share important resources as well as combat the stigma around mental health.

The House passed the #HeroesAct 117 days ago but the Trump Administration’s failure to lead has left states with their backs against the wall when it comes to providing: 🏠 Rental assistance 🚌 Safe public transit 📚 Safe reopening of schools 🏬 Small biz aid #SaveOurStates

The #2020Census deadline is less than a month away! Filling it out only takes a few minutes but has lasting impact for the next 10 years. Census data informs funding for over 100 programs including Medicaid Head Start and SNAP. Fill out the census at https://t.co/4AhQORiH7N.

We discussed the challenges currently facing our schools as they navigate remote learning & how we can best support them through this crisis. The investments we make in our children today or lack there of will have lasting effects on them all. We need to put our #FamiliesFirst. https://t.co/owF8TyomL1

Through this time it is our duty to ensure that the needs of our students are being met. Today I had the opportunity to have a discussion with @mayorcabaldon Washington Unified School District Superintendent Linda Luna & School Board President Preston Jackson. #FamiliesFirst

Did you know Sacramento County now gets your COVID-19 test results back in 72 hours? Please visit their website to find the nearest community testing site to you.   https://t.co/4n00WAPq4G https://t.co/LhcYNZCPQ3

57 years ago Dr. King led hundreds of thousands in a march on our nation’s capital. He inspired us with his dream of racial & economic justice. Today we still march on to root out systemic racism and injustice - and I will continue to fight in Congress for a more just America.

Now more than ever Americans are relying on a fully functioning USPS. For Older Americans & people with disabilities it is vital to have the confidence that their Social Security benefits & prescription medications will arrive on time. I joined @RepDebHaaland to demand action. https://t.co/Nw9YadMO0o

100 years after the passage of the #19thAmendment the 116th Congress has over 100 women members from across the country. On this #WomensEqualityDay we honor the women who came before us and recommit ourselves to empowering ALL people to participate in our democracy. https://t.co/UglkyVsjh1

Hundreds of millions of Americans rely on the @USPS for paychecks & life-saving prescriptions as well as mail-in ballots. That's why I'm co-sponsoring the "Delivering for America Act" & heading back to D.C. to vote on this important bill.   Read more in the @SacNewsReview today: https://t.co/31tKgz53qv

100 years ago our country took a significant step towards equality & passed the 19th Amendment. Yet the struggle for equality did not stop there. We remain persistent in our fight. Powerful women continue to stand against injustice & help reshape our country for the better. https://t.co/j1aKoSiAUe
Today I visited @TheCAMuseum's newest exhibit the “Fight for the Right: 100 Years of Women Voting.”   You can see it online on August 26th! https://t.co/Bd2nGu3d19

I joined @TheHillEvents to talk about our national COVID response and how we can encourage innovation within our current healthcare ecosystem to address and eliminate disparities. https://t.co/wxRUl0zPvI

That's why I am co-sponsoring the “Delivering for America Act" and stand with my Sacramento neighbors to lift up our voices. I will do everything in my power to protect the Postal Service and our postal workers from these attacks.

This post office behind me is a pillar of our economy & our democracy. The Postal Service from the founding of our country has connected all Americans. We will not stand idly by while this Administration dismantles our Postal Service. #DontMessWithUSPS https://t.co/IFYwaGuaVp

Americans count on @USPS to conduct business get prescription medications critical supplies and exercise their right to vote. Democrats will do everything in our power to protect the Postal Service and our democracy from President Trump. #DontMessWithUSPS https://t.co/J4CSVFU1Ag

The Sacramento region is experiencing an extreme heatwave. @SacCountyCA and @YoloCountyCA have opened cooling centers for residents seeking refuge from the heat. Please stay cool and safe by drinking plenty of water.  https://t.co/nJBgpNrQPK

Without Social Security 2 in 5 older Americans would be living in poverty. As a Co-Chair of the House Task Force on Aging and Families I am working to strengthen Social Security ensuring everyone can have a dignified safe retirement. https://t.co/IxirkhvUV0
For 85 years #SocialSecurity has meant economic security for millions of America's seniors people with disabilities and their families. #SocSec85

Now more than ever it is vital to stay connected. We must do everything we can to ensure Americans irrespective of their location receive the support they need to stay online. That’s why I called on the FCC to expand phone and broadband connectivity for Lifeline recipients. https://t.co/PuDMWTPpXL

Having a reliable efficient @USPS has never been more important. An attack on the USPS is an attack on our democracy & economy. Millions rely on the USPS to vote receive life-saving medications run their businesses & communicate with loved ones.   We must #SaveTheUSPS.

The pandemic has amplified the food insecurity faced by our families and children. I joined my colleagues to call on USDA to renew school meal waivers for the entire 2020-2021 school year. We must continue to ensure students and families get nutritious meals through this crisis. https://t.co/Qt7nHfw7IJ

A complete Census count is vital for a more equitable future but the pandemic has delayed important Census operations. That is why I joined my colleagues in calling for an extension to Census reporting deadlines and the inclusion of much needed funds in the next relief package. https://t.co/Ro8zc5ZhMX

Today on the 55th Anniversary of the #VotingRightsAct we are reminded that EVERY American deserves to have their voice heard.    To honor our friend and colleague John Lewis we must continue fighting to protect the right to vote for EVERY American. ##ForThePeople https://t.co/3q7U6zAce2

The @USPS cannot be left without funding. It is vital in our everyday lives. Especially as we stay home to combat the spread of #COVID19 we must ensure a reliable postal system. I joined my colleagues to strongly support providing immediate emergency funding to the USPS. https://t.co/FsO403Nazg
51% of Latinx and 48% of Black women do not have enough money to pay for basic necessities. @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct MONTHS ago to ease this burden. @SenateGOP must #PassTheHeroesAct!

Women of color are particularly vulnerable to the economic and health impacts of COVID-19 yet they are also critical to maintaining the health and economic stability of their families and communities as breadwinners caregivers and front line workers.

Today's Appropriations bill will advance crucial priorities like increasing broadband access advancing medical research and supporting police reform. This is a comprehensive bill that makes crucial investments as we combat the spread of #COVID19 and encourage economic recovery. https://t.co/g6IZzyfYt7
#OnThisDay 55 years ago #Medicare & #Medicaid became law. These critical programs have saved countless American lives. We must continue to fight to #ProtectOurCare.

Our region is home to countless nonprofits who work tirelessly to serve our communities seniors children and most vulnerable neighbors. I joined my colleagues to call for support for these vital groups in the next stimulus package. https://t.co/dcBk6Rbcjx

This action compounds the uncertainty of thousands of lives. It is our moral duty to protect dreamers & immigrant communities. The Senate must follow the House in passing the Dream & Promise Act end these attacks on Dreamers & open a path to citizenship. https://t.co/Tztep2TIcV

We all need to continue to do our part to slow the spread of COVID-19 and wear a face covering! This is a friendly reminder that your mask needs to cover both your nose and mouth to be most effective. #MaskUp https://t.co/2CicqVLjVs

Yesterday evening on the House Floor I honored a wonderful friend John Lewis. His impact will be forever felt in our nation’s conscience and we are all better for it. He simply made our country a better place. Rest in power my friend. https://t.co/glbo2zhZIZ

We are facing public health economic and social crises amid the #COVID19 outbreak. Now is the time to expand National Service and empower Americans to give back to their communities so we can make them stronger & healthier for everyone. Let’s #Stand4Service. https://t.co/2lsFQjF3qA

Today the House passed the #NoBanAct to end the xenophobic Muslim Ban. We cannot allow an Administration to upend our immigration system and upend our ideals. We must always stand up and speak out. https://t.co/eeGHYeBZM1
I’m not a regular mom. I’m a cool mom because I #WearAMask.   #OnWednesdaysWeWearPink https://t.co/a7e9iqAnCA

The Constitution requires that every PERSON be counted in the census. The Trump Administration continues to use scare tactics to incite anti-immigrant sentiment & racism. I will continue to stand with our immigrant community and make sure all are counted. https://t.co/VcpyTGG5u3

Experts say the United States needs 2.1 million daily tests three times what we have now. Ending this shortage is what the Defense Production Act is meant to help achieve. The Admin needs to act now. https://t.co/KQrsN95wNB

John was our moral compass and now we must continue his work – our work – holding our country accountable to be the best version of itself. I will miss this gentle giant my friend and my colleague. My prayers are with the Lewis family. We will all fight on in his honor.
At this moment in our history when speaking truth to power is so vital it is more important than ever to follow John’s words to ‘stand up speak out and keep your eyes on the prize.’

America has lost one of its brightest beacons of light – John Lewis – a humble giant whose light emanated from within him but who never sought the limelight for himself. He lived every single day to overcome injustice eradicate racism & give hope to all who walked beside him.

I joined my colleagues to oppose this rule and support all those who have suffered disproportionately from environmental injustice. We must stand firm and protect the air we breathe and the water we drink – I will continue working to oppose these reckless changes. https://t.co/rvH8Ejm2ZW

Amid a pandemic the Administration has finalized its rollback of the NEPA our nation’s bedrock environmental law that is central to community input on projects that may impact air and water quality. https://t.co/SJgwEKXE6U

Today @EnergyCommerce passed six of my bills – covering our communications networks and emergency preparedness telehealth access mental health care and the safety of prescription drug and food labels.   Read more here: https://t.co/5i6JSKm6OS

With the challenges of this continuing pandemic public transit is crucial. @RideSacRT is a community pillar for driving economic growth & equity throughout the region. I am thrilled these funds will enable them to safely serve their riders & employees through this crisis. https://t.co/9WH1cmu6dh

I'm glad that the Trump Administration has rescinded its harmful restrictions on international students. This directive was made without regard for the well-being of our universities and communities. https://t.co/T7pJBV9Ekk

@SacCountyCA has been operating six community testing centers in various communities across the county. Five of these sites have had to shut down due to supply shortages. We need these sites operational as soon as possible.
Last week I called on state and federal officials to immediately direct resources to Sacramento’s #COVID19 testing sites amid a shortage of vital reagents and supplies. https://t.co/GmKOLJDU3W

Contact tracing is an important tool to help slow the spread and save lives!  California’s strict privacy laws ensure your phone call will not be tracked and real tracers will only ask about your #COVID19 symptoms and contacts. https://t.co/lGIkiBcA2g

I joined my colleagues in demanding answers from @ICEgov and @DHSgov on the Trump Administration’s xenophobic announcement forcing international students to choose between unsafe learning environments travel that risks the spread of COVID-19 or deportation. https://t.co/059L3UhGuF

At today's @EnergyCommerce hearing I asked about the importance of making #COVID19 resources available in multiple languages especially for the Spanish speaking population of California to ensure equal access to resources for all consumers. https://t.co/kHvROr5F1R

Sacramento is not whole without our arts and cultural communities. Our creative community helps us tells our stories helps us heal and helps us breaks barriers. With CARES Act funds @TheCityofSac has grants to help our creative community continue to create and thrive. https://t.co/0pFcrIBwq1

In May I pressed the SBA to be more transparent about companies receiving PPP loans & today the administration publicly released some data.  This initial information only reinforces the need for additional data & more strict Congressional oversight.     https://t.co/Be5qveLRBu

Happy 4th of July! Although our barbeques fireworks and parties will need to look different this year I hope everyone has a safe and healthy #IndependenceDay!   Through our celebrations please continue to social distance and wear a mask to keep our community safe. https://t.co/BQFHLFc1T1

This 4th of July weekend it is vital that we remain cautious and do our part to prevent the spread of #COVID19. Please celebrate safely by wearing your mask and avoiding crowds. Stay healthy and have a Happy 4th of July! https://t.co/OQL0w4dyyC

Just voted to pass the #MovingForward Act a comprehensive infrastructure package that will prioritize resiliency combat climate change & create economic opportunities across the nation. I'm proud that it includes my bills the Diesel Emissions Reduction Act and TREES Act. https://t.co/KVOE0buzv6

56 years ago the #CivilRightsAct outlawed discrimination and segregation based on race religion sex or national origin.    But the fight for justice continues. We will not stop until EVERY AMERICAN has full and equal access to their American dream. https://t.co/dGRnqVyXYE

Investing in our nation's infrastructure means bringing it into the 21st century. It means modern roads bridges & transit systems. It means investments to combat #ClimateChange & expand broadband access. The #MovingForward Act is a promise of a better future for all Americans. https://t.co/5OetanigBz

The ACA unlocked access to care for millions of Americans who had long been priced out of the system. Building on that foundation we can further expand coverage and give more American families relief from soaring health care costs.
This bill will help lower the cost of coverage encourage remaining states to expand Medicaid and allow Medicare to negotiate fair prescription drug prices.

During this pandemic access to affordable care is more important than ever. That is why I just voted to support the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act. #LowerCostsforCare https://t.co/eju92oNGnP

This decision is a win for women’s reproductive rights but the fight is not over.   We must pass the Women's Health Protection Act and demand that all women have access to affordable safe and reliable reproductive care.

Today #SCOTUS struck down Louisiana’s law restricting abortion access and women’s reproductive health care.   Structural barriers are already endemic in our health care system – yet when it comes to abortion care the most restrictions are put on those who can least afford it. https://t.co/8ptlXToZYj

Five years ago today #SCOTUS ruled that every American has the right to marry the person they love.   We celebrate that landmark decision today and must continue to fight for the rights of the LGBTQ+ community into the future. #loveislove

An unprecedented public health crisis. Millions unemployed and uninsured.    Yet the Trump Administration has decided now is the time to take away healthcare from millions of Americans.   We must expand affordable care for vulnerable communities & make sure we #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/Zsc9yGCcoS

I stand with those across the country who have lifted their voices shared their pain and called on us to enact meaningful change. The George Floyd #JusticeinPolicing Act is a positive step towards a safer more equal and more just America. https://t.co/lVxwvo1rb4

Covered California announced that they have extended their special enrollment period to July 31st in response to the #COVID19 pandemic. If you are still in need of health coverage please visit their website below for further information. https://t.co/QxVL1DACOF

Today @SacCountyCA in partnership with @TheCityofSac has launched a new testing site in Natomas which is open every TUESDAY from 1-5 PM. Please see the county’s website below for info on all SIX community testing sites and to schedule appointments.    https://t.co/4n00WAPq4G

We were not prepared for this pandemic and we have paid the price with 120k+ American lives and counting. At today’s @EnergyCommerce hearing I asked Dr. Fauci how we can make sure we don’t repeat our mistakes when a second wave hits. https://t.co/pJ10bGo77W

That is why it is essential to have accessible testing sites like these in every section of our community that are free of charge. We cannot deny the fact that the virus continues to spread. We must continue to wear our masks wash our hands & practice social distancing.

Yesterday I visited the newest @SacCountyCA #COVID19 testing site with county health officials Dr. Beilenson and Dr. Kasirye. As we reopen our communities and businesses it is critical that we closely monitor cases and use data to inform our strategy for safely moving forward. https://t.co/vWAq5NR4FB
My statement in observance of Juneteenth below: https://t.co/xpWpxU3cg1
Today we commemorate the end of slavery in the United States. However the fight for justice and equality continues. Change is long overdue. #Juneteenth https://t.co/v0Z340LPDi
In recognition of the contributions of Dreamers around the Sacramento region and @SacState my joint statement with @PrezNelsen below: https://t.co/kiHn3BotkU

It is time for Senator McConnell to take up and pass the Dream and Promise Act not just for the prosperity of our country but in recognition of the dignity rights and contributions of Dreamers and immigrants.

8 years ago DACA granted young Dreamers across our country protections that provided them a path to pursue their dreams free from the fear of deportation. Today #SCOTUS ruled to uphold DACA & strike down the Administration's attempt to end the program. https://t.co/fLGoDHYBMc

Civic engagement is power. If you have not already done so please complete your #2020Census so we can ensure that power is distributed equally in our country and everyone has the representation they deserve. You can also respond at https://t.co/YTltnX7gHg by phone or by mail.
